name: draw_svg
description: Draw an SVG to the screen using simulated pen input. The input_description and output_description are used to build a plan for the actual output.

input_description.description: Description of what was detected in the input image. Include the exact pixel x, y, width, height bounding box coordinates of everything.

input_features.description: A list of exact bounding boxes for important features of the input

items.description: A specific feature and bounding box

top_left_x_px.description: The top-left x coordinate in px

top_left_y_px.description: The top-left y coordinate in px

bottom_right_x_px.description: The bottom-right x coordinate in px

bottom_right_y_px.description: The bottom-right y coordinate in px

output_description.description: Description of what will be drawn. Include the exact pixel x, y, width, height bounding box coordinates of what you want to draw.

svg.description: SVG data to be rendered. This is drawn on top of the input image, and should be the same size as the input image (768x1024 px). The display can only show black and white. Try to place the output in an integrated position. Use the `Noto Sans` font-family when you are showing text. Do not use a style tag tag. Do not use any fill colors or gradients or transparency or shadows. Do include the xmlns in the main svg tag.
